definition: unspoken rules (usually ones that codify improper behaviors such as leveraging guanxi to get favorable treatment, or coercing employees for sexual favors)
(conjunction used to express contrast with a previous clause) but/then/standard/norm/principle/to imitate/to follow/classifier for written items

sentences.english: Our problem is, bribery has become a hidden regulation of society connivance.
sentences.chinese: 我們的問題是，行賄受賄成爲社會默認的潛規則。
貴公司的潛規則是什麼？

sentences.english: The latent regulation embeds in the normal regulation and in the traditional culture.
sentences.chinese: 潛規則交易嵌於正式規則和傳統文化當中。

sentences.english: Depressingly, these market-distorting shenanigans are part of a pattern.
sentences.chinese: 令人沮喪的是，這些扭曲市場的詭計成了潛規則。

sentences.english: Baidu's entertainment spirit is to do away with hidden rules and regulations, and let the talented have the opportunity.
sentences.chinese: 打破潛規則，讓有才的人有機會，是百度娛樂的精神。

sentences.english: Do your job well, and you can sleep with sexy movie stars who depend on you.
sentences.chinese: 混得好的話，你可以潛規則那些有求於你的性感女星。

sentences.english: Hidden rules always cost a lot, some of them are not retrievable.
sentences.chinese: 其實潛規則也要付出代價的，有些根本無法挽回。

sentences.english: In addition to what's highlighted in the company handbook, what are the unwritten rules?
sentences.chinese: 除了公司手冊中的要點之外，還有哪些潛規則？

sentences.english: I think there must be some hidden rules that you do not know.
sentences.chinese: 你聽說最近發生在大學裏的潛規則醜聞了麼？

sentences.english: This is the principle behind Japanese style homes.
sentences.chinese: 這就是日本式家園的潛規則。

definition: person who writes articles - newspapers, magazines, blogs (informal)/scribe/copyist/a talented writer of articles or of calligraphy
to lose money instead of being paid (i.e. sb should pay me, but is actually taking my money)
to leave (the stage, an exam room, the playing field etc)/to take part in some activity/to take an examination (in the imperial examination system)
to take one's seat according to the ticket number/(fig.) to put (things or people) in their right place/to take a general comment as a personal attack
to expel (a member of an organization)/to fire (an employee)
"sensational headline writers", people who write misleading titles in order to generate clicks from Internet users/clickbait
When you enter a village, follow the local customs (idiom); do as the natives do/When in Rome, do as the Romans do
to offer for sale/to sell/to sell out or betray
